content.question: The furnace in a home consumes heating oil during a particular month at a rate modeled by the function <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> given by <math alttext="F of t, equals 0.3 plus, 0.1 t, minus 0.85 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 pi over 15, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, t plus 5, close parenthesis, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0.85</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in gallons per day and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of days since the start of the month. How many gallons of oil does the furnace consume during the first 14 days of the month (from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>) ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
